description: After tense talks in the Oval Office, congressional leaders said they were hopeful they could reach a deal to avert a partial government shutdown on Friday. But they appeared divided on Ukraine aid.
title: Congressional leaders hope to avoid a shutdown. But Ukraine aid is still unclear

description: Aaron Bushnell's death in Washington, D.C., is the latest example of an extreme form of protest that people have used to express their grievances and attract the attention of a global audience.
title: Why self-immolation has been used by political protesters for decades

description: The new CEO is culling "underproductive" locations, while opening more upscale Bloomingdale's and Bluemercury stores. Here's what's happening with the chain.
title: Why Macy's is closing 150 department stores

description: Senator Tammy Duckworth has introduced a bill to protect access to IVF. She tells NPR about her own experience with fertility treatments and her attempts to build bipartisan support for her bill.
title: Could IVF access be protected nationally? One senator has a plan

description: Michigan voters critical of Biden's support of Israel call on people to vote "uncommitted" in the state's primary. An Oxford scholar explains the history of self-immolation as political protest.
title: Young Michigan voters are 'uncommitted' to Biden; U.S. airman dies of self-immolation

description: A new study seeks to find the reasons that health-care personnel avoid the easy treatment for this potentially life-threatening condition.
title: There's a cheap and effective way to treat childhood diarrhea. So why is it underused?

description: Lindsay Lohan and other celebrities were tricked into calling for the ouster of Moldova's president. It's the latest example of the Cameo app being used for an apparent political propaganda operation.
title: Cameo is being used for political propaganda — by tricking the stars involved

description: The campaign to check "Uncommitted" on the Michigan Democratic primary ballot has gained nationwide attention. At its center are the next generation of activists, leaders and voters.
title: On primary day, young Michigan voters are leading call to be 'uncommitted' to Biden

description: Researchers analyzed a sample of about 221 million prescriptions from 2016 to 2022, in Americans between the ages of 12 and 25. The increase was prominent among young women and girls.
title: The rate of antidepressants prescribed to young people surged during the pandemic

description: The dictionary publisher's guidance on the practice has people riled up. Grammarians say the made-up rule is one big waste of time. Not everyone is ready to let it go.
title: Can a preposition be what you end a sentence with? Merriam-Webster says yes

description: Have you experienced financial trouble after a flood, wildfire, hurricane or heat wave? NPR's Climate Desk wants to hear about it.
title: Have you been financially impacted by a weather disaster? Tell us about it

description: Both President Biden and former President Donald Trump are vying for their party's delegates. Neither contest is expected to be competitive even though the state will be key in the general election.
title: Michigan Democrats and Republicans wrap up their presidential primaries today

description: When Ben Gomes got a call saying that his mother was badly injured, he feared the worst. But when he arrived at the hospital, he learned how a stranger's quick thinking had saved her.
title: A stranger jumped into action when a 92-year-old started to be dragged by a car

description: In the days after Alabama's Supreme Court deemed frozen embryos to be "extrauterine children," the chief justice's ties to a movement that experts call "Christian extremist" have come to light.
title: Alabama justice's ties with far-right Christian movement raise concern

description: Navy Capt. Victor Glover, who spent nearly six months aboard the International Space Station, will be among four astronauts to venture back to the moon for the first time since 1972.
title: A child's dream to 'drive' a space shuttle propels him toward a historic NASA mission

description: Floods, wildfires and hurricanes can have long-term financial consequences for college-age people. As climate change makes disasters more common, more and more students are struggling.
title: Debt, missed classes and anxiety: how climate-driven disasters hurt college students

description: The former president's lawyers filed notices of appeal Monday asking the state's mid-level appeals court to overturn the Feb. 16 verdict and reverse penalties that threaten Trump's cash reserves.
title: Donald Trump appeals $454 million judgment in New York civil fraud case

description: Intuitive Machines, the company that built and flew the spacecraft, said it will continue to collect data until sunlight no longer shines on the solar panels, expected to happen Tuesday morning.
title: Odysseus moon lander will cease working after sideways landing

description: Ruth Gottesman is a professor emerita of pediatrics at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine in New York City. Gottesman's late husband, David, left the money to her upon his death.
title: Tuition will be free at a New York City medical school thanks to a $1 billion gift

description: Voting concludes Tuesday in Michigan's presidential primaries. Follow the results live.
title: Here are Michigan's 2024 presidential primary results

description: The number of pedestrians killed on U.S. roads declined by 4% in the first half of last year, according to preliminary estimates. But pedestrian fatality numbers are still far above their 2019 levels.
title: Pedestrian deaths fell modestly last year, but there's still a safety 'crisis'

description: Negotiators have been trying to reach a deal on a temporary cease-fire to to move hostages held in Gaza out of the territory. President Biden says he's optimistic the cease-fire could begin in a week.
title: Biden says there could be a cease-fire in Gaza by Monday. Talks are still ongoing
